word:
The Lord told Moses to sanctify the people, because He was coming near to them. He requires of His people today that they shall stand as a separate and distinct people, free from all worldly influences. They are to be a peculiar people unto the Lord. And then He gave them His commandments, promising them life if they would keep the commandments. And we, if we obey them, shall find entrance into the kingdom of our God, where we shall continue to 
                                                                           120
observe the law of God. Let no one dare to trifle with the commandments of God. Ms 71, 1907, pp. 1, 2. ("Clear the King's Highway," preached Sabbath, February 16, 1907.)
